properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 10 at 2:36PM MST until January 11 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Boise ID
properties.description:
...HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW THIS WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...

.Snow will begin across east-central Oregon and the mountains
of west-central Idaho tonight as the first in a series of low
pressure systems impacts the region. The mountains will see
periods of heavy snow through at least Tuesday as three separate
storm systems track through the Pacific Northwest. Valleys will
see periods of snow through Tuesday with accumulating snow
becoming more likely into early next week.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations around 2 inches,
except 2 to 4 inches over the mountains. Winds gusting as high
as 35 mph.

* WHERE...Southern Twin Falls County zone.

* WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 5 PM MST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM MST SATURDAY
